data.name: Star Aegis
data.detailed_description:
Star Aegis is a shoot'em up without shooting. Use your shields to reflect bullets.

  • Wave-based, scorechasing old school arcade experience.
  • Your shields are powerful but limited. You need to defend and reflect from one side while tactically dodge from the other.
  • Choose between ramming enemy ships with your shield for a smaller score or go for broke by reflecting bullets back at them.

  • Main graphics, programming and all of audio made by one developer, one-man band style (hope you like guitars).

  • A short but intense experience. I tried capturing the experience of playing a couple of rounds at the arcade before going to school.


How high can you score? How long can you endure as the last line of defense?

data.short_description: Star Aegis is an old school, wave-based arcade shmup without shooting. Choose which side of the ship to protect with your shields and reflect the enemies bullets back at them or just ram them down with your shield.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 SP1+
  • Processor: Intel Core2 Quad Q8200 (4 * 2330) / AMD Athlon II X4 645 AM3 (4 * 3100)
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 512+
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 70 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Anything capable of playing audio
